                    ### Question
                    A Patient who is on antihypertensive drug develops a dry cough. Which of the following drug might be responsible for the condition:

                    ### Options
                    opa. Diuretics
opb. ACE inhibitors
opc. Calcium channel blockers
opd. Beta blockers

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
ACE inhibitors are known to cause dry cough due to the accumulation of bradykinin in the respiratory tract, a side effect confirmed by the inhibition of peptidyl-dipeptidase A (angiotensin-converting enzyme). This mechanism is well-supported by medical consensus and relevant biochemical pathways. Other drug classes listed (diuretics, calcium channel blockers, and beta blockers) do not typically cause dry cough through their primary mechanisms of action.
